content.en: Ship maneuvering prediction: Researchers have explored the use of various algorithms, such as support vector regression (SVR), support vector machines (SVM), and artificial bee colony algorithm, to model and predict the maneuvering motion of ships. These algorithms are capable of identifying response models, estimating hydrodynamic coefficients, and overcoming noise and outliers in ship track modeling. Additionally, algorithms like extended Kalman filter and ν-Support Vector Machine (ν-SVM) have been used for parameter identification and ship maneuvering motion identification, respectively. These findings contribute to the development of simplified models and prediction methods for ship dynamics.
content.da: Forudsigelse af skibsmanøvrering: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige algoritmer, såsom support vector regression (SVR), support vector machines (SVM) og kunstig biekoloni algoritme, for at modellere og forudsige skibes manøvreringsbevægelse. Disse algoritmer er i stand til at identificere responsmodeller, estimere hydrodynamiske koefficienter og håndtere støj og outliers i skibssporingsmodellering. Derudover er algoritmer som udvidet Kalman-filter og ν-Support Vector Machine (ν-SVM) blevet anvendt til henholdsvis parameteridentifikation og identifikation af skibsmanøvreringsbevægelse. Disse fund bidrager til udviklingen af forenklede modeller og forudsigelsesmetoder for skibsdynamik.
